intro: Thunbergia subfulva, commonly known as the yellow flame vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. The plant has heart-shaped, velvety leaves that are dark green in color, providing a lush backdrop to its vibrant blooms. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its beauty and ease of care. Thunbergia subfulva is a member of the Acanthaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and medicinal plants.
